s0011: In his play, he enjoyed planting hemp and beans; the hemp and beans grew beautiful.
s0012: When he became an adult, he loved farming. He assessed the suitability of the land; where grain was suitable he planted crops, and the people all followed his example.
s0013: Emperor Yao heard of this and appointed Qi as the Minister of Agriculture. All under Heaven benefited from this, and he had merit.
s0014: Emperor Shun said: 'Qi, when the black-haired people first went hungry, you, Houji, sowed the timely hundred grains.'
s0015: He enfeoffed Qi at Tai, titled him Houji, and established the Ji clan surname.
s0016: Houji's rise occurred during the time of Yao Tang, Yu, and Xia; all had excellent virtue.
s0017: When the Xia declined, the worthy descendants of Houji continued to hold the title.
s0018: When King Wen of Zhou arose, he examined the descendants of Houji and found Gong Liu.
s0019: Gong Liu had merit. He moved from Bin to Qi, and the people followed him.
s0020: When King Wen observed Gong Liu, he said: 'My ancestor Houji founded our clan. I should restore the title of Houji.'
